definition[0]: relating to what you do to achieve what you want, especially as part of a game or large plan
note[0]: tactical error/mistake/blunder (=a mistake that will harm your plans later)
example[0]: Two players were substituted for tactical reasons.
example[1]: a tactical decision to send in troops
definition[1]: relating to the way military forces are arranged in a battle
definition[2]: done in order to achieve what you want at a later time, especially in a large plan
example[2]: Their agreement was a tactical move to avoid the threat of legal action.
definition[3]: a mistake that will harm your plans in the future
example[3]: It was probably a tactical mistake to offer the contract to a new company.
